alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Doddridge; Harrison; Lewis; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 18 at 4:54PM EST until November 18 at 5:30PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Doddridge County in northern West Virginia... Taylor County in northern West Virginia... Northern Lewis County in northern West Virginia... Northwestern Upshur County in northeastern West Virginia... Northern Barbour County in northeastern West Virginia... Southern Harrison County in northern West Virginia... * Until 530 PM EST. * At 453 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Grafton to 9 miles west of Jackson Mill, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 93 and 127. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 76 and 82. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 7. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Buckhannon, Grafton, Weston, Philippi, Bridgeport, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Anmoore, Jackson Mill, Stonewall Jackson, West Milford, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Flemington, Knottsville, Meadland, Tygart Lake State Park, Thornton and Alum Bridge. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. If traveling on a highway, find the nearest exit or rest area and park safely away from traffic. Allow snow squalls to pass before attempting to resume travel.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Doddridge; Harrison; Lewis; Taylor; Upshur
